docs.text:
mbaLearnsToCode
 = MBAsLearnToCode(


name=           'Vinh',
mba_school=     'Chicago Booth',
mba_class_year= '2016'



)


Eine kleine
 Icebreaker


Hi, there. 


By day, I am 
Vinh
, a dizzily-busy, multitaskingly-distracted, overly-committed full-time MBA student at Chicago Booth and daddy of a toddling little boss.


Come the quiet of the night, and I turn into 
mbaLearnsToCode
, furiously 
committing
 (word pun totally intended) snippets of computer programming code to my repositories of precious digital nothings on 
GitHub
, 
BitBucket
 and the 
Python Package Index (PyPI)
.


I code so that I can:






immerse myself in the inevitable new world of 
Machine Learning
, 
Artificial Intelligence
 and 
Robotics
, and






build little 
life-quality-enhancing apps
 to help my wife, myself - plus, 
ahem
, friends who are good to us - be less busy doing mind-numbing things such as clearing emails, managing calendars or tracking receipts.






My 
coding repertoire
 includes:




Python / Django


R


Julia


Matlab / Octave


Ruby / Rails


SQL


Pascal 
(does anyone know this language anymore??)
, and


a bunch of cloud-computing stuff such as EC2, Elastic Beanstalk, RDS, Route 53 and S3 by Amazon Web Services 
(whose parent company stays afloat probably thanks to my monthly bills)
.




What's Cool Here?






My 
Blogs
, documenting my high and low moments as 






My 
Learning Resources
 to help you if you are starting, or co-travelling, the same MBA-coder path as I am; these includes:






a jaw-droppingly comprehensive 
Data Science Learning Resources Catalog
 compiled by the people, for the people of the young but almightily awesome 
Chicago Booth Analytics Club
, which I co-founded in early 2015; and






general app-development tips










My 
Tool Room
, where I painstakingly catalog useful magic-weapon-like programming packages that coders like you and I can steal for free and summon when we have our backs against the wall (or are banging our heads against one in frustration)






Enjoy your time on my site!

name=           'Vinh',
mba_school=     'Chicago Booth',
mba_class_year= '2016'  )
docs.title: mbaLearnsToCode = MBAsLearnToCode(

docs.text: Hi, there.   By day, I am  Vinh , a dizzily-busy, multitaskingly-distracted, overly-committed full-time MBA student at Chicago Booth and daddy of a toddling little boss.  Come the quiet of the night, and I turn into  mbaLearnsToCode , furiously  committing  (word pun totally intended) snippets of computer programming code to my repositories of precious digital nothings on  GitHub ,  BitBucket  and the  Python Package Index (PyPI) .  I code so that I can:    immerse myself in the inevitable new world of  Machine Learning ,  Artificial Intelligence  and  Robotics , and    build little  life-quality-enhancing apps  to help my wife, myself - plus,  ahem , friends who are good to us - be less busy doing mind-numbing things such as clearing emails, managing calendars or tracking receipts.    My  coding repertoire  includes:   Python / Django  R  Julia  Matlab / Octave  Ruby / Rails  SQL  Pascal  (does anyone know this language anymore??) , and  a bunch of cloud-computing stuff such as EC2, Elastic Beanstalk, RDS, Route 53 and S3 by Amazon Web Services  (whose parent company stays afloat probably thanks to my monthly bills) .
docs.title: Eine kleine Icebreaker

docs.text: My  Blogs , documenting my high and low moments as     My  Learning Resources  to help you if you are starting, or co-travelling, the same MBA-coder path as I am; these includes:    a jaw-droppingly comprehensive  Data Science Learning Resources Catalog  compiled by the people, for the people of the young but almightily awesome  Chicago Booth Analytics Club , which I co-founded in early 2015; and    general app-development tips      My  Tool Room , where I painstakingly catalog useful magic-weapon-like programming packages that coders like you and I can steal for free and summon when we have our backs against the wall (or are banging our heads against one in frustration)    Enjoy your time on my site!
